# Visualizing Russian River Estuary Data

```{r include = FALSE}
require(rremat)
require(ggplot2)
require(knitr)
opts_chunk$set(fig.width = 12, fig.height = 8)
```

## CTD data

```{r plot-ctd, echo = FALSE}
data(ctd.df)

baseplot = function(p) 
  ggplot(p, aes(y = depth)) + scale_x_continuous(breaks = pretty_breaks()) +
  scale_y_reverse() + facet_wrap(~ dist, nrow = 1)

lyrs = list(
  ta = geom_path(aes(x = ta)),
  sa = geom_path(aes(x = sa)),
  fl = geom_path(aes(x = fl)),
  oa = geom_path(aes(x = oa))  
)

dates = unique(ctd.df$date)
names(dates) = paste(dates)

ctd.plots = vector("list", length = length(lyrs))
names(ctd.plots) = names(lyrs)
for(n in names(ctd.plots)){
  ctd.plots[[n]] = vector("list", length = length(dates))
  names(ctd.plots[[n]]) = paste(dates)
  for(d in names(dates))
    ctd.plots[[n]][[d]] = baseplot(subset(ctd.df, date == dates[[d]])) + 
      lyrs[[n]] + ggtitle(d)
}
```

### Temperature

```{r plot-ctd-temp, echo = FALSE}
for(p in ctd.plots$ta)
  print(p)
```

### Salinity

```{r plot-ctd-sal, echo = FALSE}

```
